headline: Why Is Tesla (TSLA) Stock Rocketing Higher Today
summary: Shares of electric vehicle pioneer Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) jumped 6.1% in the afternoon session after dovish comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell sparked a broad market rally, boosting investor sentiment for risk assets. Powell's remarks at the Jackson Hole Symposium were interpreted by traders as hinting at a potential interest rate cut, which is often seen as a positive for stocks. headline: Tesla Stock Rises. It Has a Strategy to Sell More Cybertrucks.
summary: Tesla  has spent the past few years slashing prices in a bid to improve affordability and outsell its rivals—but the electric-vehicle maker appears to be adopting a different strategy with its fastest Cybertruck.  Essentially, Tesla is bundling its highest-level driver-assistance product into the purchase price.  With other Tesla models, customers can pay a one-time fee of $8,000 or $99 a month for FSD.

raw.headline: Tesla Stock Rises. It Has a Strategy to Sell More Cybertrucks.

headline: Elon Musk Must Face Lawsuit Over Alleged $1 Million Election Lottery As Judge Cites Voter Fraud Claims, Data Harvesting Concerns

headline: Electric Vehicles Update - Federal Boost Sparks Opportunity in EV Infrastructure Expansion
summary: Recent federal guidance from the U.S. Department of Transportation and the Federal Highway Administration has directed $5 billion toward establishing dependable electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure. This initiative aims to enforce quality standards for EV charging, reflecting existing practices implemented by Orion's Voltrek division. With a significant portion of these funds still unallocated, it underscores a substantial opportunity for the wider deployment and maintenance of EV...

headline: Tesla raises price of most-expensive Cybertruck by $15,000 in US
summary: The sharp increase follows a long-delayed rollout in which the pickup has struggled to meet Tesla's early promises, with sales so far trailing expectations.  The Cyberbeast variant, which now costs $114,990, comes with a new "Luxe Package" that includes Supervised Full Self-Driving and free access to its Supercharger network.  The pricing of the model is well above CEO Elon Musk's 2019 pitch of a roughly $40,000 starting price.

raw.headline: Tesla raises price of most-expensive Cybertruck by $15,000 in US
raw.summary: The sharp increase follows a long-delayed rollout in which the pickup has struggled to meet Tesla's early promises, with sales so far trailing expectations.  The Cyberbeast variant, which now costs $114,990, comes with a new "Luxe Package" that includes Supervised Full Self-Driving and free access to its Supercharger network.  The pricing of the model is well above CEO Elon Musk's 2019 pitch of a roughly $40,000 starting price.

headline: Musk Tried to Enlist Zuckerberg to Help Finance Bid for OpenAI
summary: OpenAI said Musk identified Zuckerberg, the chief executive officer of Meta Platforms Inc., as one of the people with whom he had communicated about potentially financing a deal to purchase the ChatGPT maker.  Neither Zuckerberg nor Meta signed the letter of intent or participated in the $97.4 billion bid, OpenAI said in the filing.
